title: Types
content: = The Types enum above provides a comprehensive list of possible JavaScript and TypeScript types, including primitives like String and Number, complex structures like Map and Set, as well as iterators and typed arrays. Using such enums can help with type checking, validation, and implementing utility functions that depend on type information.

title: KeysOfType
content: KeysOfType is a utility type that extracts the keys from a type T where the value extends the type U.

title: KeysOfType
content: Use KeysOfType to filter keys of an object based on their value types.

title: KeysOfType
content: T: The source type to extract keys from.U: The type that the value must extend.

title: Callable
content: Callable is a utility type that represents a function signature. It allows you to specify the argument types and return type.

title: Callable
content: Use Callable when you need to define a generic function type with specific arguments or return type, essentially a shorthand for { (...args: Args): Return }.

title: Callable
content: Args: Tuple definition of argument types. Default is any[].Return: Return type. Default is any.

title: OmitByValue
content: OmitByValue is a utility type that constructs a new type by omitting properties from type T where the value extends type V. It combines Omit and KeysOfType.

title: OmitByValue
content: Use OmitByValue when you want to exclude properties of a specific type from an object.

title: OmitByValue
content: T: The source type.V: The type to omit values by.

title: PartialOnly
content: PartialOnly is a utility type that picks specified properties from a type and makes them optional, while removing all other properties. It effectively combines Pick and Partial.

title: PartialOnly
content: Use PartialOnly when you need a subset of a type where the selected properties should be optional.

title: PartialOnly
content: T: The source type.K: The keys to pick and make partial.

title: RequiredOnly
content: RequiredOnly is a utility type that makes specified properties of a type required, while removing all other properties. It effectively combines Pick and Required.

title: RequiredOnly
content: Use RequiredOnly when you need a subset of a type where the selected properties must be present and non-optional.

title: RequiredOnly
content: T: The source type.K: The keys to pick and make required.

title: PickByValue
content: PickByValue is a utility type that constructs a new type by picking properties from type T where the value extends type V. It combines Pick and KeysOfType.

title: PickByValue
content: Use PickByValue when you want to create a new object type containing only properties of a specific type.

title: PickByValue
content: T: The source type.V: The type to filter values by.

title: DeepPartial
content: DeepPartial is a utility type that recursively makes all properties of a type and its nested objects optional. This is similar to Partial

title: DeepPartial
content: Use DeepPartial when you need to construct an object that might only have some deep properties defined, for example when mocking data in tests or applying partial updates.

title: DeepPartial
content: T: The source type to make deeply partial.

title: IsArrowFunction
content: IsArrowFunction is a utility type that determines if a given type is an arrow function. It returns true if the type is an arrow function (doesn't have a this context), and false otherwise.

title: IsArrowFunction
content: Use IsArrowFunction when you need to conditionally type based on whether a function is an arrow function or a standard function.

title: Download Link
content: downloadLink is a utility function that programmatically triggers a file download by creating a temporary anchor element.

title: Download Link
content: Use downloadLink when you have a file URL (or Blob URL) and want to initiate a download action, for example from a button click or after an API response.

title: Download Link
content: url: The URL of the file to download. Can be a remote URL or a blob URL.fileName: The name to suggest for the downloaded file. Defaults to 'download'.

title: Download Link
content: For cross-origin URLs, the download attribute might be ignored by browsers for security reasons, resulting in navigation instead of download unless the server sends appropriate Content-Disposition headers.

title: Number
content: number is a validator that ensures the control's value is a valid finite number or a string representation of a valid finite number.

title: Number
content: Use number to validate that input values are strictly numeric.

title: Number
content: You can use the number attribute directive (or [number]) with template-driven forms.

title: Number
content: Returns a validation error object { number: { actualValue } } if validation fails, or null if valid.

title: Sort Direction
content: The ngx-oneforall/constants package provides a constant for sort directions, helping you maintain consistency across your sorting logic.

title: Sort Direction
content: Import the SORT_DIRECTION constant to use in your sorting functions or components.

title: Timeout Interceptor
content: The withTimeoutInterceptor adds automatic timeouts to HTTP requests.

title: Timeout Interceptor
content: Default timeout — Apply timeout to all requestsPer-request override — Context API for custom timeoutsStructured errors — Typed error with request metadata

title: Timeout Interceptor
content: Override the default timeout for specific requests:

title: Max Date
content: maxDate is a validator that ensures the control's value is a date less than or equal to a specified maximum date.

title: Max Date
content: Use maxDate to validate that a date is not after a certain boundary.

title: Max Date
content: This validator internally uses the date validator to first ensure the inputs are valid date structures.

title: Max Date
content: You can use the [maxDate] directive. It accepts a Date object, date string, or numeric timestamp.

title: Max Date
content: Returns { maxDate: { reason: 'date_exceeds_max', requiredDate, actualValue } } if validation fails, or null if valid.

title: Range
content: range is a validator that requires the control's value to be within a specified numerical range (inclusive).

title: Range
content: Use range to validate numeric inputs against a minimum and maximum value.

title: Range
content: You can use the [range] directive with template-driven forms. It accepts a tuple [min, max].

title: Range
content: min: The minimum required value.max: The maximum required value.

title: Range
content: Returns { range: { reason: 'out_of_range', min, max, actualValue } } if validation fails, or null if valid.

title: Min Date
content: minDate is a validator that ensures the control's value is a date greater than or equal to a specified minimum date.

title: Min Date
content: Use minDate to validate that a date is not before a certain boundary.

title: Min Date
content: This validator internally uses the date validator to first ensure the inputs are valid date structures.

title: Min Date
content: You can use the [minDate] directive. It accepts a Date object, date string, or numeric timestamp.

title: Min Date
content: Returns { minDate: { reason: 'date_before_min', requiredDate, actualValue } } if validation fails, or null if valid.

title: Phone
content: phone is a validator that checks if the control's value is a valid phone number for a specified country code.

title: Phone
content: It uses libphonenumber-js under the hood to validate phone numbers.

title: Phone
content: This validator depends on libphonenumber-js, which is 145kb in size. Using this validator will increase your bundle size. Proceed with caution if bundle size is a critical constraint.

title: Phone
content: Use phone to validate phone numbers. You must provide a CountryCode (Alpha-2 code).

title: Phone
content: You can use the [phone] attribute directive.

title: Phone
content: Returns { phone: { reason: 'invalid_format', country } } if validation fails, or null if valid.

title: Range Length
content: rangeLength is a validator that requires the length of the value (string, array, or number digits) to be within a specified range.

title: Range Length
content: Use rangeLength to validate form controls where the input size matters, such as usernames, passwords, or list selections.

title: Range Length
content: You can also use [rangeLength] directive with template-driven forms:

title: Range Length
content: min: Minimum required length.max: Maximum allowed length.

title: Range Length
content: Returns { rangeLength: { reason: 'length_out_of_range', requiredMinLength, requiredMaxLength, actualLength } } if validation fails, or null if valid.

title: Range Length
content: Throws an error if min is greater than max.

title: Device
content: The ngx-oneforall/constants package provides a constant for categorizing devices by type, which is useful for conditional logic based on the platform.

title: Device
content: Import the DEVICE_TYPE constant to use in your components or services.

title: Unsaved Changes Guard
content: Unsaved changes guards are essential for protecting users from accidentally losing their work when navigating away from a page with unsaved modifications. This guard leverages the native window.confirm dialog to prompt the user for confirmation.

title: Unsaved Changes Guard
content: Import the Guard Import unsavedChangesGuard and the HasUnsavedChanges interface:

title: Unsaved Changes Guard
content: Register the Guard Add the guard to your route configuration using canDeactivate:

title: Unsaved Changes Guard
content: Implement the Interface Implement HasUnsavedChanges in your component:

title: Unsaved Changes Guard
content: Async Checks (Optional) The hasUnsavedChanges method can return a boolean, Promise

title: Unsaved Changes Guard
content: Preventing navigation away from a form with unsaved data.Alerting users before closing a tab or browser window if changes haven't been saved.Guarding against accidental loss of progress in multi-step wizards or editors.

title: Unsaved Changes Guard
content: This demo manually triggers the guard check to show the confirmation dialog. In a real routing scenario, this would happen automatically before navigation.

title: Unsaved Changes Guard
content: You can customize the message displayed in the confirmation dialog by passing a string to the factory function.

title: Loading Status
content: loadingStatus is an RxJS operator that simplifies tracking the state of an asynchronous operation (like an API call). It automatically catches errors and provides a unified ResourceResult

title: Loading Status
content: object containing the loading status, the data, and any potential error.

title: Loading Status
content: In your component, you can then easily handle the different states:

title: Loading Status
content: Initial State: Immediately emits { status: 'loading', data: null, isLoading: true } upon subscription.Success State: When the source observable emits data, it transforms it to { status: 'success', data: T, isLoading: false }.Error State: If the source observable errors, it catches it and emits { status: 'error', data: null, error: unknown, isLoading: false }.

title: Loading Status
content: Unified State: No need to manage separate isLoading, error, and data variables or signals.Error Handling: Automatically catches errors so the stream doesn't terminate unexpectedly (it transforms the error into a value).Type Safety: Provides a strongly typed result object.

title: Live Search
content: liveSearch is an RxJS operator for implementing live search functionality with automatic debouncing, duplicate filtering, and request cancellation.

title: Live Search
content: It combines debounceTime, distinctUntilChanged, and switchMap to provide an optimal search experience.

title: Live Search
content: delay: Debounce delay in millisecondsdataProducer: A function that takes the query string and returns an Observable of search results

title: Live Search
content: Debounces input to reduce API callsFilters out consecutive duplicate valuesAutomatically cancels previous search requests when a new one is initiatedThe delay is specified in milliseconds

title: Live Search
content: Reduces server load by debouncing rapid input changesPrevents duplicate searchesAlways shows the most recent search resultsHandles race conditions automatically

title: Debug
content: debug is a utility operator that provides styled logging for RxJS streams. It wraps the tap operator to log next, error, and complete events with a custom tag and distinct CSS styles, making it easier to debug complex observable chains in the browser console.

title: Debug
content: tag: A string label that identifies the stream in the console output.when: (Optional) A function that returns a boolean. Logging only occurs if this function returns true. It receives the emitted value as an argument (for next events).

title: Debug
content: The operator uses different console methods and colors to help you distinguish between event types:

title: Debug
content: Next: console.log - Cyan background with white text.Error: console.error - Pinkish-red background with white text.Complete: console.info - Teal background with white text.

title: Debug
content: Visibility: Easily spot your stream logs among other console output.No Boilerplate: Replaces multiple tap(val => console.log(val)) calls with a single operator.State Tracking: Automatically handles error and completion logging without extra code.

title: Date
content: date is a validator that ensures the control's value is a valid date. It supports Date objects and date strings.

title: Date
content: Use date to validate date inputs.

title: Date
content: You can use the date attribute directive (or [date]) with template-driven forms.

title: Date
content: Returns a validation error object with a reason code if validation fails, or null if valid.

title: Date
content: Value cannot be parsed as a valid date

title: Date
content: Value is not a string or Date object

title: Base64 URL
content: URL-safe Base64 encoding utilities for safely transmitting data in URLs, query parameters, and tokens.

title: Base64 URL
content: Import the functions from the base64 utility:

title: Base64 URL
content: Encodes a UTF-8 string to URL-safe base64 (RFC 4648)

title: Base64 URL
content: Decodes a URL-safe base64 string to UTF-8

title: Base64 URL
content: These utilities correctly handle multi-byte Unicode characters (e.g., Chinese, emoji) using TextEncoder/TextDecoder.

title: Base64 URL
content: JWT Tokens: Encode/decode JWT payload segmentsQuery Parameters: Safely embed binary data in URLsOAuth State: Encode state parameters for OAuth flowsData URIs: Create URL-safe data identifiers

title: Typed Template
content: The TypedTemplateDirective provides a way to strictly type the context of your ng-template definitions. By default, Angular templates are weakly typed (any or Object), which can lead to runtime errors when accessing properties that don't exist. This directive bridges that gap, leveraging TypeScript's power directly within your templates.

title: Typed Template
content: This directive is purely for compile-time type checking. It does not affect runtime behavior or inject data into the template. The actual data context must still be provided via [ngTemplateOutletContext] or similar mechanisms.

title: Typed Template
content: Import TypedTemplateDirective into your component or module.

title: Typed Template
content: To type a template, start by defining the interface for your context.

title: Typed Template
content: Then, use a helper property to pass this type to the directive. This property is used purely for type inference.

title: Typed Template
content: Finally, bind [typedTemplate] to your type helper on the ng-template.

title: Typed Template
content: : Typo in a property name? Accessing a missing nested field? TypeScript will catch these errors at build time, preventing runtime crashes.

title: Typed Template
content: : Enjoy full autocomplete and refactoring capabilities for variables inside your templates, just like in your TypeScript files.

title: Typed Template
content: : It explicitly documents the data shape expected by the template, making the code easier to understand and maintain for your team.

title: Installation
content: Install the library via npm or yarn:

title: Installation
content: ngx-oneforall is modular by design. Import only what you need from its specific path.

title: Installation
content: Since the library is tree-shakable, only the features you actually import will be included in your final bundle.

title: Installation
content: Check that your Angular version is compatible.

title: Installation
content: Check for any peer dependency warnings during installation.

title: Only In Browser
content: The OnlyInBrowser decorator ensures methods only execute in browser environment, not during SSR.

title: Only In Browser
content: Value to return when not in browser

title: Only In Browser
content: SSR-safe - Prevents browser-specific code from running on serverFallback support - Return custom value during SSRZero config - Works without options for void methods

title: Only In Browser
content: Accessing window or documentDOM manipulationBrowser storage (localStorage, sessionStorage)Browser-only libraries

title: Deep Computed
content: deepComputed creates a computed signal that allows readonly nested property access using proxy syntax. This is useful for accessing deeply nested properties as signals, rather than repeatedly calling the root signal.

title: Deep Computed
content: If you need writable nested properties, use stateSignal instead.

title: Deep Computed
content: Use deepComputed when you have complex nested objects in signals and want individual property access.

title: Deep Computed
content: factory: A computation function that returns an object.

title: Deep Computed
content: Returns a proxy-wrapped computed signal that provides nested signal access.

title: Deep Computed
content: Signal Access: Each nested property returns a computed signalProxy Recursion: Nested objects are recursively wrapped in deepComputedCaching: Signals and proxies are cached for performanceType Safety: Full TypeScript support with proper type inference

title: Deep Computed
content: deepComputed only works with plain objects. Arrays and built-in types (Date, Map, etc.) are returned as regular signals.

title: Deep Computed
content: Complex nested state from storesDeeply nested API responsesAvoiding repetitive signal calls

title: Deep Computed
content: State is flat or simplePerformance is critical (adds proxy overhead)Working with arrays or collections

title: Match Field
content: matchFields is a group-level validator that checks if two fields have matching values. Commonly used for "confirm password" or "confirm email" fields.

title: Match Field
content: Applied at the FormGroup level so it detects changes to both fields:

title: Match Field
content: Name of the first control to compare

title: Match Field
content: Name of the second control to compare

title: Match Field
content: When validation fails, returns error on the FormGroup (not individual controls):

title: Match Field
content: Use the matchFields directive with an array of field names:

title: Safe Await
content: Go-style error handling for async operations. Returns a tuple [result, error] instead of throwing, eliminating try/catch blocks.

title: Safe Await
content: Observables are converted using lastValueFrom. Empty Observables (complete without emitting) will return an EmptyError.

title: Safe Await
content: HTTP requests: Handle API errors without try/catchForm submission: Clean async validation and submissionSequential operations: Chain multiple async calls with clear error pointsObservable integration: Use with Angular's HttpClient seamlessly

title: Unique Component ID
content: Generates unique ID strings for Angular components. Useful for form elements, ARIA attributes, and dynamically created components.

title: Unique Component ID
content: Returns a unique string in the format {prefix}{counter}.

title: Unique Component ID
content: Each prefix has its own independent counter. btn1, btn2, input1, input2 instead of a shared global counter.

title: Unique Component ID
content: Form controls: Associate labels with inputs via for/id pairingARIA attributes: aria-labelledby, aria-describedby, aria-controlsDynamic components: Ensure unique IDs across multiple instancesAccordion/tabs: Link triggers to their content panels

title: Url
content: url is a validator that ensures the control's value is a valid absolute URL string.

title: Url
content: Use url to validate that input values are valid URLs. It supports configuration for restricting protocols.

title: Url
content: You can use the [url] directive with template-driven forms. It accepts a UrlValidatorOptions object.

title: Url
content: protocols?: readonly string[]: List of allowed protocols (e.g., ['https', 'ftp']). Only checked for absolute URLs.skipProtocol?: boolean: If true, allows URLs without a protocol scheme (e.g., google.com). Default false.

title: Url
content: Value is not a valid URL

title: Url
content: Protocol does not match allowed list

title: Safe Html Pipe
content: The SafeHtmlPipe bypasses Angular's HTML sanitization to render trusted HTML content.

title: Safe Html Pipe
content: ⚠️ Security Warning Only use with trusted content. User input must be sanitized server-side.

title: Safe Html Pipe
content: CMS content - Admin-generated HTML from a trusted CMSMarkdown output - Pre-rendered markdown that's already sanitizedStatic HTML - Hardcoded HTML strings in your codebase

title: Safe Html Pipe
content: User input - Never use with unsanitized user-provided contentExternal APIs - Content from untrusted third-party sourcesQuery parameters - URL parameters or form inputs

title: Safe Html Pipe
content: Returns SafeHtml for valid stringsReturns empty SafeHtml for null/undefinedThrows error for non-string values

title: Safe Html Pipe
content: Uses Angular's DomSanitizer.bypassSecurityTrustHtml() to mark content as trusted. This bypasses XSS protection, so ensure content is safe before use.

title: Hash
content: Fast, non-cryptographic string hashing utilities for generating numeric hash codes.

title: Hash
content: Generates a salted hash using the salt's hash as seed

title: Hash
content: Uses the DJB2-like algorithm, equivalent to Java's String.hashCode():

title: Hash
content: Cache Keys: Generate numeric keys for caching mechanismsHash Tables: Distribute objects across bucketsQuick Comparison: Fast string equality pre-checkPartitioning: Consistent assignment to shards/partitions

title: Hash
content: This is a non-cryptographic hash. Do not use for passwords, security tokens, or any security-sensitive application. Use crypto or bcrypt instead.

title: Param Guard
content: paramGuard is a functional guard that validates route parameters (path variables) before allowing activation of a route. It works similarly to queryParamGuard but for route parameters.

title: Param Guard
content: To use paramGuard, provide it in your route configuration using canActivate. It is particularly useful for validating required parameters in routes like /item/:id.

title: Param Guard
content: The paramGuard factory takes a ParamGuardConfig object:

title: Param Guard
content: List of parameter keys that must be present and non-empty.

title: Param Guard
content: A custom function to validate parameters.

title: Param Guard
content: Optional URL to redirect to if validation fails (uses

title: File to Base64
content: Converts a File object to a base64-encoded data URL string asynchronously.

title: File to Base64
content: The file object from an input element

title: File to Base64
content: Image Previews: Display uploaded images before submissionFile Uploads: Convert files to base64 for API transmissionAvatar Editors: Create inline image previewsForm Data: Store file content in JSON payloads

title: Catch Error
content: The CatchError decorator catches errors and provides fallback behavior for sync, Promise, and Observable methods.

title: Catch Error
content: Value or function to return on error

title: Catch Error
content: Sync methods: Wraps in try-catchPromises: Adds .catch() handlerObservables: Pipes through catchErrorDynamic fallback: Function receives error, can return dynamic valueRe-throw: If fallback is undefined, error is re-thrown

title: Query Param Guard
content: queryParamGuard is a functional guard that validates query parameters before allowing activation of a route. It can check for required parameters and apply custom logic via a predicate function.

title: Query Param Guard
content: To use queryParamGuard, provide it in your route configuration using canActivate:

title: Query Param Guard
content: The queryParamGuard factory takes a QueryParamGuardConfig object:

title: Query Param Guard
content: List of query parameter keys that must be present and non-empty.

title: Query Param Guard
content: A custom function to validate query parameters.

title: Query Param Guard
content: Optional URL to redirect to if validation fails (uses

title: Query Param Guard
content: If redirectTo is not provided, the guard will simply return false on failure.

title: Event
content: A lightweight pub-sub service for event-based communication between Angular components and services.

content: Dispatch Events — Publish custom events with optional typed payloadsType-Safe Subscriptions — Use generics for typed event dataDecoupled Communication — No direct component references neededSSR Safe — Works in server-side rendering environments

content: Use generics to get typed event data:

content: Dispatches an event with name and optional data

content: Returns typed observable stream of events

content: Detects clicks outside an element, useful for closing dropdowns, modals, and popovers.

content: Capture Phase — Detects clicks even when stopPropagation() is calledZone Optimized — Runs outside Angular zone for better performanceToggleable — Enable/disable via clickOutsideEnabled inputSSR Safe — Only activates in the browser

content: Emits when a click occurs outside the element

title: Time

content: Import the TIME constant to use in your timers or logic.

content: All values are represented in milliseconds.

title: Call Pipe
content: The CallPipe invokes a function directly from the template with pure pipe caching. This prevents unnecessary change detection cycles since the function is only re-evaluated when its reference or arguments change.

title: Call Pipe
content: Arguments to pass to the function

title: Call Pipe
content: Without the pipe, functions in templates are called on every change detection:

title: Call Pipe
content: When using methods that rely on this, ensure the context is preserved:

title: Call Pipe
content: Pure - Only re-evaluates when function reference or arguments changeType-safe - Generic typing for better type inferenceNull-safe - Returns null if input is not a function

title: First Error Key
content: The FirstErrorKeyPipe extracts the first validation error key from a form control's errors. It supports optional priority ordering to control which error displays first.

title: First Error Key
content: Errors object from a form control

title: First Error Key
content: Optional array of error keys in priority order

title: First Error Key
content: By default, returns the first error key in object order. With priority, returns the first matching priority key:

title: First Error Key
content: Returns first key that exists in errors

title: First Error Key
content: Falls back to first available key if no matches

title: First Error Key
content: Returns empty string '' if no errorsPure pipe - re-runs when errors object reference changesAlways use control.errors (not control) for reactive updates

title: Credit Card
content: creditCard is a validator that checks if the control's value is a valid credit card number using the Luhn algorithm.

title: Credit Card
content: It enforces specific PAN lengths (13, 15, 16, 19) and validates 15-digit cards as American Express (must start with 34 or 37). It also handles non-numeric characters (separators) by stripping them before validation.

title: Credit Card
content: Use creditCard to validate credit card inputs.

title: Credit Card
content: You can use the creditCard attribute directive.

title: Credit Card
content: Returns a validation error object with a reason code if validation fails, or null if valid.

title: Credit Card
content: PAN length is not 13, 15, 16, or 19 digits

title: Simple Changes
content: A type-safe version of Angular's SimpleChanges that provides proper typing for ngOnChanges lifecycle hook. Eliminates the need for type assertions when accessing change properties.

title: Simple Changes
content: The previous value before the change

title: Simple Changes
content: The current value after the change

title: Simple Changes
content: True if this is the initial binding

title: Simple Changes
content: Returns true if this is the initial binding

title: Simple Changes
content: All properties are optional (?) since not all inputs change on every ngOnChanges cycle.

title: Simple Changes
content: Type-safe change detection: Access previous/current values without castingAutocomplete support: IDE provides suggestions for available propertiesRefactoring safety: Rename refactoring works correctly across componentsBetter error detection: Catch typos at compile time

title: Memoize
content: The @memoize decorator caches method results based on arguments. Works with sync and Promise methods.

title: Memoize
content: When to use: Use @memoize for sync or Promise methods. For Observable methods, use @Cache instead.

title: Memoize
content: Sync and Promise support - Caches both method returns and promise resolutionsPer-instance caching - No shared state between instancesCustom key resolver - Use object IDs instead of full serializationMax cache size - Limit cache with LRU eviction

title: Memoize
content: Pure methods only - Don't use on methods with side effectsUse maxSize for large caches - Prevent memory leaksUse resolver for objects with IDs - Faster than serialization

title: Click Throttle
content: Throttles click events to prevent accidental double-clicks and rapid repeated interactions.

title: Click Throttle
content: Immediate Response — First click fires instantly (leading edge)Configurable Delay — Set throttle interval via throttleTime inputReactive — Updates throttle duration when input changesSSR Safe — Only activates in the browser

title: Click Throttle
content: First click in each window is emitted immediatelySubsequent clicks within the throttle period are ignored

title: Debounced
content: debouncedSignal creates a read-only signal that delays updates until the source signal stops changing for a specified duration. Ideal for search inputs, form validation, and window resize handling.

title: Debounced
content: Use debouncedSignal to wait for rapid changes to settle before reacting.

title: Debounced
content: Returns a read-only signal that reflects the source value after the delay.

title: Debounced
content: The internal timer is automatically cleaned up when the injection context is destroyed.

title: Debounced
content: Search input with API callsForm validation on changeWindow resize handlersAuto-save functionality

title: Debounced
content: You need immediate responseYou want rate limiting instead (use throttledSignal)

title: Route Params
content: routeParamSignal creates a reactive signal that tracks route parameters. It automatically updates when the URL's route parameters change, eliminating manual subscriptions.

title: Route Params
content: Use routeParamSignal to reactively access route parameters in signal-based components.

title: Route Params
content: Returns a signal with the current parameter value, or null if not present.

title: Route Params
content: Returns a signal containing the full ParamMap of route parameters.

title: Route Params
content: Both signals automatically update when navigation changes the route parameters.

title: Route Params
content: Detail pages (/products/:id)Nested routes with parametersDynamic route segmentsMaster-detail layouts

content: You need query parameters (use routeQueryParamSignal)You need route data, not params (use ActivatedRoute.data)

title: Route Query
content: routeQueryParamSignal creates a reactive signal that tracks URL query parameters. It automatically updates when query strings change, eliminating manual subscriptions.

title: Route Query
content: Use routeQueryParamSignal to reactively access query parameters in signal-based components.

title: Route Query
content: Returns a signal with the current parameter value, or null if not present.

title: Route Query
content: Returns a signal containing the full ParamMap of query parameters.

title: Route Query
content: Both signals automatically update when navigation changes the query string.

title: Route Query
content: Search pages (?q=angular)Filter and sort controlsPagination (?page=2)Shareable URLs with state

title: Route Query
content: You need route path parameters (use routeParamSignal)You need fragment data (use ActivatedRoute.fragment)

title: Is Key Defined
content: Type guard utility that checks if an object has a defined (non-undefined) value for a given key, with TypeScript type narrowing.

title: Is Key Defined
content: Only check own properties, exclude inherited

title: Is Key Defined
content: This function acts as a type guard—when it returns true, TypeScript narrows the type to guarantee the key's value is non-nullable.

title: Is Key Defined
content: Safe property access: Prevent "cannot read property of undefined" errorsForm validation: Verify required fields are presentAPI responses: Safely access dynamic object propertiesType narrowing: Let TypeScript know a property is defined

title: Press Enter

title: Safe Serialize
content: Safely serializes any JavaScript value to a JSON string, including non-JSON types like functions, symbols, BigInt, and circular references. Produces deterministic output for caching and memoization.

title: Safe Serialize
content: Object keys are sorted alphabetically for deterministic output. { b: 2, a: 1 } serializes the same as { a: 1, b: 2 }.

title: Safe Serialize
content: Memoization keys: Generate cache keys from any argumentsArgument hashing: Create stable fingerprints for function callsDeep comparison: Compare complex objects by their serialized formLogging: Serialize non-JSON values for debugging

title: Safe Serialize
content: Not reversible: Cannot deserialize back to original valuesLossy for functions/symbols: Only names/descriptions are preservedWeakMap/WeakSet: Cannot iterate, serialized with placeholderSame-name collision: Different functions with same name produce same output

title: Catch Error With Fallback
content: The catchErrorWithFallback operator provides a clean, flexible way to handle errors in RxJS streams by automatically switching to a fallback value, observable, or dynamically generated result when an error occurs.

content: Form Validation: Validate numeric input fieldsType Narrowing: Let TypeScript know a value is a numberAPI Responses: Safely handle mixed number | string dataData Parsing: Check before parseInt or parseFloat

title: Session Storage
content: Type-safe wrapper around browser sessionStorage with transformers for different data types.

title: Session Storage
content: Type-Safe — Use transformers for JSON, Number, Boolean, Date, Base64Key Prefix — Optional prefix for all keysSSR Safe — Falls back to in-memory storage on serverNew Methods — keys() and getAll() for bulk operationsSession Scoped — Data cleared when browser tab closes

title: Session Storage
content: On server-side rendering, SessionStorageService automatically uses in-memory storage (no errors).

title: Correlation ID Interceptor
content: The withCorrelationIdInterceptor is an Angular HTTP interceptor that automatically adds a unique correlation ID header to each HTTP request. It enables request tracking, debugging, and distributed tracing across services.

title: Correlation ID Interceptor
content: Automatic ID generation — Unique ID added to every requestDistributed tracing — Track requests across microservicesCustom header name — Use your own header (default: X-Correlation-Id)Custom ID generator — Provide your own ID generation logicPer-request control — Disable or override via HttpContextSSR-compatible — Works on both server and browser

title: Correlation ID Interceptor
content: Every request automatically includes a correlation ID:

title: Correlation ID Interceptor
content: Header name for the correlation ID

title: Correlation ID Interceptor
content: Uses crypto.randomUUID() when available, with a fallback for older browsers:

content: The interceptor processes requests in the following order:

content: — If header already present, don't override

title: Correlation ID Interceptor
content: — Use context ID, or generate a new one

title: Correlation ID Interceptor
content: The interceptor is fully compatible with server-side rendering (SSR) and will add correlation IDs to requests made on the server.

content: If a request already has the correlation ID header, it won't be overridden:

title: File Extension
content: The ngx-oneforall/constants package provides a comprehensive set of common file extensions. These constants are useful for file type validation, filtering, and handling file uploads.

title: File Extension
content: Import the FILE_EXTENSION constant to use in your file handling logic.

title: Base URL Interceptor
content: The withBaseUrlInterceptor is an Angular HTTP interceptor that automatically prepends a base URL to all relative HTTP requests. It eliminates repetitive URL construction across your application.

title: Base URL Interceptor
content: Single configuration point — Define your API base URL onceRelative paths — Use /users instead of https://api.example.com/usersDynamic URLs — Support for functions that resolve URLs at runtimePath-specific overrides — Route different paths to different base URLsPer-request control — Disable or override via HttpContextSmart slash handling — Automatically normalizes trailing/leading slashes

content: Default base URL for all relative requests

content: Base URL to use when prefix matches

title: Base URL Interceptor
content: The baseUrl option is required. The interceptor throws an error if not provided.

title: Keys
content: The ngx-oneforall/constants package provides sets of constants for keyboard keys and their corresponding numeric codes. These are useful for handling keyboard events in a type-safe way.

title: Keys
content: You can use these constants when listening to keyboard events to avoid hardcoding strings or magic numbers.

title: Keys
content: The Key constant contains standard string values for keys, typically matching event.key.

title: Keys
content: Includes digits 0-9 (value matches digit) and letters a-z (lowercase).

title: Keys
content: The KeyCode constant contains the numeric values for keys, typically matching event.keyCode.

title: Find Type
content: Comprehensive type detection utility that returns a Types enum value for any JavaScript value. Supports all primitives, collections, typed arrays, and iterators.

title: Find Type
content: All type checking functions are also exported as type guards:

title: Find Type
content: Detection order is optimized for common types first. More specific types (like GeneratorFunction) are checked before general ones (like Function).

title: Find Type
content: API validation: Check data types from external sourcesDynamic rendering: Render different UI based on value typeForm handling: Validate input values before processingDebugging: Log precise runtime types

title: Introduction
content: ngx-oneforall is a collection of 80+ high-quality Angular utilities designed to solve common development challenges. Instead of reinventing the wheel or managing dozens of small dependencies, you get a unified toolkit that just works.

title: Introduction
content: One For All - A single library providing the essential blocks for modern Angular development.

title: Introduction
content: Every utility is written from scratch and optimized specifically for Angular. We prioritize memory efficiency and runtime performance rather than just wrapping existing heavy libraries. Maximum size of a utility is 3kb gzipped.

title: Introduction
content: Import only what you use. The library is fully tree-shakable, so adding one utility doesn't bloat your bundle with the rest of the library.

title: Introduction
content: We keep the dependency tree clean. ngx-oneforall has NO third-party dependencies (except libphonenumber-js for the phone validator). This reduces security risks, simplifies updates, and prevents version conflicts.

title: Introduction
content: Built for modern hydration. Every component and utility is designed to work seamlessly in Server-Side Rendering (SSR) environments out of the box.

title: Introduction
content: We take reliability seriously. The entire library is fully covered by tests to ensure edge cases are handled and behavior remains consistent across updates.

title: Introduction
content: Designed with Signals and Standalone Components in mind. This isn't a legacy port—it's built for the current and future state of Angular.

title: Introduction
content: Avoid copy-pasting the same regex patterns, validators, and helper functions between projects. Use a standardized, tested set of utilities instead.

title: Introduction
content: Don't waste time maintaining generic boilerplate code. Use these proven primitives to build your actual application features faster.

title: Introduction
content: Fully typed APIs and consistent behavior make these utilities predictable and easy to work with. You get strict typing and comprehensive documentation right in your IDE.

title: Introduction
content: Found a bug or edge case? Have an idea for a new utility? We'd love to hear from you!

title: Introduction
content: Report Issues: If you encounter any bugs or unexpected behavior, please open an issue.Feature Requests: Have a utility in mind that would benefit the community? Submit a feature request via GitHub Issues.
